inputs.name: Possible Community List Names
inputs.help_text: Enter the possible community list names, separated by commas, to collect device attributes for the endpoints monitored through SNMP.

inputs.name: Profile All Discovered Devices Using SNMP (Host)
inputs.help_text: Optionally, select to profile all the discovered devices using SNMP (Host).

inputs.name: Add Subnets for Manual Scan
inputs.visible_when: Profile All Discovered Devices Using SNMP (Host) is unchecked
inputs.help_text: If the number of discovered devices exceeds 1000, it is recommended to add subnets manually to scan only Windows devices.

actions.description: Clears the settings and reverts to default settings.

constraints: If the number of discovered devices exceeds 1000, it is recommended to add subnets manually to scan only Windows devices.
Ensure SNMP is enabled and properly configured on the network devices to allow data collection.

errors.trigger: Community list names are not comma-separated or contain invalid characters.

errors.message: Too many devices discovered. Please add subnets manually.
errors.trigger: Number of discovered devices exceeds 1000 without subnet configuration.

state_transitions.trigger: Invalid SNMP community list or scan configuration.

workflows.name: Configure SNMP (Host) Profiling
steps: Navigate to Profiler -> Profiler Configuration -> Advance Configuration.
Optionally, select to profile all discovered devices using SNMP (Host).
If required, add subnets manually for scanning.
prerequisites: Ensure SNMP is enabled on network devices.
Verify network devices support SNMP (Host) profiling.
